newsitem.title: FINLAND: Hartwall says Coke co-op to end.
newsitem.headline: Hartwall says Coke co-op to end.

text.p: Finnish beverages group Oy Hartwall Ab said in a statement on Tuesday its agreement with U.S. Coca-Cola Co to produce, sell and distribute Coca-Cola products in Finland would continue until end-1998 and then end.
"Cooperation will end due to different views on long-term strategy," Hartwall said.

Coca-Cola would pay Hartwall a one-time compensation of about 200 million markka in 1997-99, and a "little more than half of the total compensation" would "have a positive effect on the financial results of Hartwall" in 1997 and 1998, it said.
Hartwall's sales of Coca-Cola products in Finland amounted to 86 million litres in 1996, or 14.8 percent of total group sales volume, and 22.4 percent of domestic sales volume.
Coca Cola products accounted for 8.9 percent of Hartwall's operating profit in 1996 -- excluding the Baltic Beverages Holding joint venture, it said.
The compensation includes the working capital involved with Hartwall's Coca-Cola operations as well as its shares of Oy CC Cold Drink Ab, which will be transferred to Coca-Cola on December 30, 1997.
The transition period would give each company sufficient time for the necessary reorganisation of their operations, Hartwall said.
"Hartwall aims to maintain its position as the leading Finnish beer and soft drinks company, with own strong brands also in the latter product group," it said.
